New Records: The Hungarian national soccer team will extend their winning streak to 13 games, surpassing the record set in the early 2000s if they avoid defeat against Turkey.
Pre-Game Insights: The Hungarian national soccer team has maintained an unbeaten streak since November 17, 2022, with 12 matches played.
Under the coaching of Marco Rossi, the national team will face Turkey in their first 2024 preparation match on Friday.
The game will be played in front of a full house, advising spectators to arrive at the venue at least one and a half hours before kick-off and to utilize public transportation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last time the national team enjoyed such a successful run was over 20 years ago, between March 2000 and April 2001, when they remained unbeaten for 12 matches.
The last team to achieve a comparable streak was the ‘Golden Team,’ who won 15 of 18 games and drew three after losing the 1954 World Cup final.
Their streak was halted in February 1956, when they were defeated by the Turkish team scoring 3-1 in Istanbul.
